title: Arisaig Walk Route

images.title: Beach, Arisaig by Richard Webb, CC BY-SA 2.0 <https://creativecommons.org/licenses/by-sa/2.0>, via Wikimedia Commons
images.caption: Beach, Arisaig. Etymologically, Arisaig means "safe bay".

images.title: Foreshore, Arisaig by Nigel Brown, CC BY-SA 2.0 <https://creativecommons.org/licenses/by-sa/2.0>, via Wikimedia Commons
images.caption: Foreshore, Arisaig

images.title: Arisaig by Richard Webb, CC BY-SA 2.0 <https://creativecommons.org/licenses/by-sa/2.0>, via Wikimedia Commons
images.caption: Arisaig. The village is located in Lochaber, Inverness-shire. It lies 7 miles (11 kilometres) south of Mallaig on the west coast of the Scottish Highlands, within the Rough Bounds. Arisaig is also the traditional name for part of the surrounding peninsula south of Loch Morar, extending east to Moidart.

images.title: The Canal, Arisaig by Jim Barton, CC BY-SA 2.0 <https://creativecommons.org/licenses/by-sa/2.0>, via Wikimedia Commons
images.caption: The Canal

images.title: Jetty at Arisaig by Oliver Dixon, CC BY-SA 2.0 <https://creativecommons.org/licenses/by-sa/2.0>, via Wikimedia Commons
images.caption: Jetty at Arisaig

images.title: Chris Downer / Arisaig: view over Seideal na Ceapaich
images.caption: View over Seideal na Ceapaich

description: This walk explores the lovely coastal village of Arisaig in Lochaber, Scottish Highlands. You can enjoy a circular walk around the Strath of Arisaig using country lanes and other footpaths. On the walk you can enjoy views of the local canal and across the bay to the Isle of Skye, the small isles and the surrounding mountains. You can continue your walking in the area by heading north to the beautiful Silver Sands Of Morar , Loch Morar and Mallaig .
